page.title: 13WOMENS INSTITUTE-I REMEMBER
page.content: Mrs Thorpe the school secretary is a member of the W.I. She remembers her Mother helping during the war with W. I. work. All surplus soft fruit was collected from all the villages in the area, taken to Whixley Hall where it was made into jam to be sold to local shops. They used primus stoves to boil the jam because there was no electricity in the washhouse. Some villages took surplus produce to York Market each Saturday morning to sell. The W.I. nowadays meets once each month at Whixley Village Hall. They have speakers, demonstrations and competitions.They cater for village activities such as fetes and sports. They have joint meeting with other groups in September. The officers at the moment are Mrs.A. Watson, President and Mrs P. Orton,Secretary.
